metadata.Title: CVE-2020-6831 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A buffer overflow could occur when parsing and validating SCTP chunks in WebRTC. This could have led to memory corruption and a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 68.8, Firefox < 76, and Thunderbird < 68.8.0.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2020-6831` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 76.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 76.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 76.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:68.8.0+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:68.8.0+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:68.8.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:68.8.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:68.8.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:68.8.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '76.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:68.8.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
